summary.para: The DVD_AudioAttributes structure is used in to receive the various audio attributes of the disc.
Indicates the current audio mode. If the mode returned is DVD_AudioMode_Karaoke, call to get more info.
Describes the format (encoding mode) of the audio stream.
An LCID value indicating the language of the audio stream. Is zero if no language is present.
A enumeration that will be filled in if any information is available on the disc.
Indicates whether multichannel attributes are present. If TRUE, it means there is additional mixing information available, such as for SurroundSound. Call to retrieve the multichannel information.
The frequency in hertz (48k, 96k) of the audio stream.
The resolution of the audio stream (16, 20, 24 bits, or other) Zero indicates the resolution is unknown.
The number of channels. For example, 5.1 Dolby AC-3 has six channels.
